str2: And there, and yonder, there also. From kai and ekei; likewise in that place.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A centurion of the Roman army. Or hekatontarchos hek-at-on'-tar-khos; from hekaton and archo; the captain of one hundred men.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Alexandrian, belonging to Alexandria in Egypt. From the same as Alexandreus; Alexandrine, or belonging to Alexandria.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Another form for pleuo; which is used as an alternate in certain tenses; probably a form of pluno; to pass in a vessel.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Italy. Probably of foreign origin; Italia, a region of Europe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I embark, put on board, step into. From en and bibazo; to place on, i.e. Transfer.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
